articles.title: GM’s boss responds to customers’ soaring appetite for SUVs and pickups
articles.description: Mary Barra idles five factories, attracting President Donald Trump’s ire
articles.content: THE CAR industrys changing fortunes have left a deep mark on Detroits urban landscape. Its once-bustling Fisher body plant, Fords Highland Park and the Packard factory became vast, abandoned graffitied shellsa sad reminder of the former might of Americas moto… [+4034 chars]

articles.title: The struggle to get Ebola vaccine to rebel-held areas of Congo
articles.description: Jabs can stop a foul epidemic. But men with machetes can stop the vaccinators
articles.content: WHEN A YOUNG woman living near Beni (the epicentre of the Democratic Republic of Congos latest Ebola outbreak) came down with a fever, a nurse told her to go to the clinic for a test. But by the time the virus was detected in her blood, she was in the back of… [+3312 chars]

articles.title: The rise and fall of Christmas music
articles.description: These days seasonal albums are mostly made by middle-aged musicians for middle-aged listeners
articles.content: CHRISTMAS MUSIC as we know it was born in 1963, when Phil Spector corralled his stable of singers into the studio to record A Christmas Gift For You From Phil Spector. Until then, there had only been schmaltzy carols and easy listening staples, with occasiona… [+4002 chars]

articles.title: What, and who, are France’s “gilets jaunes”?
articles.description: Yellow-jacketed protesters have blocked roundabouts and motorway toll booths nationwide
articles.content: IMAGES OF burning barricades, riot police and tear gas on the Champs-Elysées in Paris have brought Frances gilets jaunes (yellow vests) to the worlds attention. The name refers to the high-visibility jackets that these protesters have adopted as a symbol of t… [+2824 chars]

articles.description: Western Canadian Select recently hit a low of $13.46 a barrel
